trans-unit.source: Examples of Shared Access Signatures
trans-unit.target: Examples of Shared Access Signatures

trans-unit.source: This topic shows sample uses of shared access signatures with the REST API.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows sample uses of shared access signatures with the REST API.

trans-unit.source: Shared access signatures permit you to provide access rights to containers and blobs, tables, queues, or files.
trans-unit.target: Shared access signatures permit you to provide access rights to containers and blobs, tables, queues, or files.

trans-unit.source: By providing a shared access signature, you can grant users restricted access to a specific container, blob, queue, table, or table entity range for a specified period of time.
trans-unit.target: By providing a shared access signature, you can grant users restricted access to a specific container, blob, queue, table, or table entity range for a specified period of time.

trans-unit.source: For complete details on constructing, parsing, and using shared access signatures, see <link xlink:href="98f3411e-d85d-4be9-809e-135b3d4ed436" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Delegating Access with a Shared Access Signature (REST API)</link>.
trans-unit.target: For complete details on constructing, parsing, and using shared access signatures, see <link xlink:href="98f3411e-d85d-4be9-809e-135b3d4ed436" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Delegating Access with a Shared Access Signature (REST API)</link>.

trans-unit.source: For information about using the .NET storage client library to create shared access signatures, see <legacyLink xlink:href="b41f98e9-14ab-499a-9fd2-fb9202c9ccd2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create and Use a Shared Access Signature</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For information about using the .NET storage client library to create shared access signatures, see <legacyLink xlink:href="b41f98e9-14ab-499a-9fd2-fb9202c9ccd2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create and Use a Shared Access Signature</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: Blob Examples
trans-unit.target: Blob Examples

trans-unit.source: This section contains examples that demonstrate shared access signatures for REST operations on blobs.
trans-unit.target: This section contains examples that demonstrate shared access signatures for REST operations on blobs.

trans-unit.source: Example: Get a Blob using a Container’s Shared Access Signature
trans-unit.target: Example: Get a Blob using a Container’s Shared Access Signature

trans-unit.source: Versions Prior to 2013-08-15
trans-unit.target: Versions Prior to 2013-08-15

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to construct a shared access signature for read access on a container.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to construct a shared access signature for read access on a container.

trans-unit.source: The signed signature fields that will comprise the URL include:
trans-unit.target: The signed signature fields that will comprise the URL include:

trans-unit.source: The signature is constructed as follows:
trans-unit.target: The signature is constructed as follows:

trans-unit.source: The request URL specifies read permissions on the <userInput>pictures</userInput> container for the designated interval.
trans-unit.target: The request URL specifies read permissions on the <userInput>pictures</userInput> container for the designated interval.

trans-unit.source: Note that the resource represented by the request URL is a blob, but the shared access signature is specified on the container.
trans-unit.target: Note that the resource represented by the request URL is a blob, but the shared access signature is specified on the container.

trans-unit.source: It's also possible to specify it on the blob itself.
trans-unit.target: It's also possible to specify it on the blob itself.

trans-unit.source: Version 2013-08-15 and Later
trans-unit.target: Version 2013-08-15 and Later

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to construct a shared access signature for read access on a container using version 2013-08-15 of the storage services.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to construct a shared access signature for read access on a container using version 2013-08-15 of the storage services.

trans-unit.source: Version 2013-08-15 introduces new query parameters that enable the client issuing the request to override response headers for this shared access signature only.
trans-unit.target: Version 2013-08-15 introduces new query parameters that enable the client issuing the request to override response headers for this shared access signature only.

trans-unit.source: The response headers and corresponding query parameters are as follows:
trans-unit.target: The response headers and corresponding query parameters are as follows:

trans-unit.source: Response header name
trans-unit.target: Response header name

trans-unit.source: Corresponding SAS query parameter
trans-unit.target: Corresponding SAS query parameter

trans-unit.source: The fields that comprise the string-to-sign for the signature include:
trans-unit.target: The fields that comprise the string-to-sign for the signature include:

trans-unit.source: The string-to-sign is constructed as follows:
trans-unit.target: The string-to-sign is constructed as follows:

trans-unit.source: The shared access signature specifies read permissions on the <ui>pictures</ui> container for the designated interval.
trans-unit.target: The shared access signature specifies read permissions on the <ui>pictures</ui> container for the designated interval.

trans-unit.source: Note that the resource represented by the request URL is a blob, but the shared access signature is specified on the container.
trans-unit.target: Note that the resource represented by the request URL is a blob, but the shared access signature is specified on the container.

trans-unit.source: It's also possible to specify it on the blob itself.
trans-unit.target: It's also possible to specify it on the blob itself.

trans-unit.source: For a client making a request with this signatures, the <link xlink:href="a3e943b4-5745-4e64-9d6f-728bbefbd5ee" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob (REST API)</link> operation will be executed if the following criteria are met:
trans-unit.target: For a client making a request with this signatures, the <link xlink:href="a3e943b4-5745-4e64-9d6f-728bbefbd5ee" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob (REST API)</link> operation will be executed if the following criteria are met:

trans-unit.source: The signature in the request successfully authenticates against the storage account.
trans-unit.target: The signature in the request successfully authenticates against the storage account.

trans-unit.source: The request is made within the time frame specified by the shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: The request is made within the time frame specified by the shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: The request does not violate any term of an associated stored access policy.
trans-unit.target: The request does not violate any term of an associated stored access policy.

trans-unit.source: The blob specified by the request (<ui>/myaccount/pictures/profile.jpg</ui>) resides within the container specified as the signed resource (<ui>/myaccount/pictures</ui>).
trans-unit.target: The blob specified by the request (<ui>/myaccount/pictures/profile.jpg</ui>) resides within the container specified as the signed resource (<ui>/myaccount/pictures</ui>).

trans-unit.source: Note that specifying <codeInline>rsct=binary</codeInline> and <codeInline>rscd=file; attachment</codeInline> on the shared access signature overrides the content-type and content-disposition headers in the response, respectively.
trans-unit.target: Note that specifying <codeInline>rsct=binary</codeInline> and <codeInline>rscd=file; attachment</codeInline> on the shared access signature overrides the content-type and content-disposition headers in the response, respectively.

trans-unit.source: A successful response for a request made using this shared access signature will be similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: A successful response for a request made using this shared access signature will be similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: Example: Upload a Blob using a Container’s Shared Access Signature
trans-unit.target: Example: Upload a Blob using a Container’s Shared Access Signature

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to construct a shared access signature for writing a blob.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to construct a shared access signature for writing a blob.

trans-unit.source: In this example, we construct a signature that grants write permissions for all blobs in the container.
trans-unit.target: In this example, we construct a signature that grants write permissions for all blobs in the container.

trans-unit.source: Then we use the shared access signature to write to a blob in the container.
trans-unit.target: Then we use the shared access signature to write to a blob in the container.

trans-unit.source: The signed signature fields that will comprise the URL include:
trans-unit.target: The signed signature fields that will comprise the URL include:

trans-unit.source: The signature is constructed as follows:
trans-unit.target: The signature is constructed as follows:

trans-unit.source: The request URL specifies write permissions on the <userInput>pictures</userInput> container for the designated interval.
trans-unit.target: The request URL specifies write permissions on the <userInput>pictures</userInput> container for the designated interval.

trans-unit.source: Note that the resource represented by the request URL is a blob, but the shared access signature is specified on the container.
trans-unit.target: Note that the resource represented by the request URL is a blob, but the shared access signature is specified on the container.

trans-unit.source: It's also possible to specify it on the blob itself.
trans-unit.target: It's also possible to specify it on the blob itself.

trans-unit.source: With this signature, <link xlink:href="b213c30f-8d30-4718-ba77-2030f3009719" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Put Blob</link> will be called if the following criteria are met:
trans-unit.target: With this signature, <link xlink:href="b213c30f-8d30-4718-ba77-2030f3009719" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Put Blob</link> will be called if the following criteria are met:

trans-unit.source: The signature in the request successfully authenticates against the storage account.
trans-unit.target: The signature in the request successfully authenticates against the storage account.

trans-unit.source: The request is made within the time frame specified by the shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: The request is made within the time frame specified by the shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: The request does not violate any term of an associated stored access policy.
trans-unit.target: The request does not violate any term of an associated stored access policy.

trans-unit.source: The blob specified by the request (/myaccount/pictures/photo.jpg) is in the container specified as the signed resource (/myaccount/pictures).
trans-unit.target: The blob specified by the request (/myaccount/pictures/photo.jpg) is in the container specified as the signed resource (/myaccount/pictures).

trans-unit.source: Example: Delete Blob using a Blob’s Shared Access Signature
trans-unit.target: Example: Delete Blob using a Blob’s Shared Access Signature

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to construct a shared access signature that grants delete permissions for a blob, and deletes a blob.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to construct a shared access signature that grants delete permissions for a blob, and deletes a blob.

trans-unit.source: Note that a shared access signature for a DELETE operation should be distributed judiciously, as permitting a client to delete data may have unintended consequences.
trans-unit.target: Note that a shared access signature for a DELETE operation should be distributed judiciously, as permitting a client to delete data may have unintended consequences.

trans-unit.source: The signed signature fields that will comprise the URL include:
trans-unit.target: The signed signature fields that will comprise the URL include:

trans-unit.source: The signature is constructed as follows:
trans-unit.target: The signature is constructed as follows:

trans-unit.source: The request URL specifies delete permissions on the pictures container for the designated interval.
trans-unit.target: The request URL specifies delete permissions on the pictures container for the designated interval.

trans-unit.source: Note that the resource represented by the request URL is a blob, and the shared access signature is specified on that blob.
trans-unit.target: Note that the resource represented by the request URL is a blob, and the shared access signature is specified on that blob.

trans-unit.source: It's also possible to specify it on the blob’s container to grant permission to delete any blob in the container.
trans-unit.target: It's also possible to specify it on the blob’s container to grant permission to delete any blob in the container.

trans-unit.source: With this signature, <link xlink:href="7f64072c-fcc6-4e7d-8653-5017dc8da7be" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Delete Blob</link> will be called if the following criteria are met:
trans-unit.target: With this signature, <link xlink:href="7f64072c-fcc6-4e7d-8653-5017dc8da7be" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Delete Blob</link> will be called if the following criteria are met:

trans-unit.source: The signature in the request successfully authenticates against the storage account.
trans-unit.target: The signature in the request successfully authenticates against the storage account.

trans-unit.source: The request is made within the time frame specified by the shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: The request is made within the time frame specified by the shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: The request does not violate any term of an associated stored access policy.
trans-unit.target: The request does not violate any term of an associated stored access policy.

trans-unit.source: The blob specified by the request (/myaccount/pictures/profile.jpg) matches the blob specified as the signed resource.
trans-unit.target: The blob specified by the request (/myaccount/pictures/profile.jpg) matches the blob specified as the signed resource.

trans-unit.target: In this example, we construct a signature that grants write permissions for all files in the share.

trans-unit.source: Then we use the shared access signature to write to a file in the share.
trans-unit.target: Then we use the shared access signature to write to a file in the share.

trans-unit.source: Example: Delete File using a File’s Shared Access Signature
trans-unit.target: Example: Delete File using a File’s Shared Access Signature

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to construct a shared access signature that grants delete permissions for a file, then uses the shared access signature to delete the file.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to construct a shared access signature that grants delete permissions for a file, then uses the shared access signature to delete the file.

trans-unit.source: A shared access signature for a DELETE operation should be distributed judiciously, as permitting a client to delete data may have unintended consequences.
trans-unit.target: A shared access signature for a DELETE operation should be distributed judiciously, as permitting a client to delete data may have unintended consequences.

trans-unit.target: The request URL specifies delete permissions on the pictures share for the designated interval.

trans-unit.source: Note that the resource represented by the request URL is a file, and the shared access signature is specified on that file.
trans-unit.target: Note that the resource represented by the request URL is a file, and the shared access signature is specified on that file.

trans-unit.source: It's also possible to specify it on the file’s share to grant permission to delete any file in the share.
trans-unit.target: It's also possible to specify it on the file’s share to grant permission to delete any file in the share.

trans-unit.target: The request is made within the time frame specified by the shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: Queue Examples
trans-unit.target: Queue Examples

trans-unit.source: This section contains examples that demonstrate shared access signatures for REST operations on queues.
trans-unit.target: This section contains examples that demonstrate shared access signatures for REST operations on queues.

trans-unit.source: In these examples, the Queue service operation only runs after the following criteria are met:
trans-unit.target: In these examples, the Queue service operation only runs after the following criteria are met:

trans-unit.source: The signature in the request successfully authenticates against the storage account.
trans-unit.target: The signature in the request successfully authenticates against the storage account.

trans-unit.source: The request is made within the time frame specified by the shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: The request is made within the time frame specified by the shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: The request does not violate any term of an associated stored access policy.
trans-unit.target: The request does not violate any term of an associated stored access policy.

trans-unit.target: The queue specified by the request is the same queue authorized by the shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: Example: Retrieve Messages using a Shared Access Signature
trans-unit.target: Example: Retrieve Messages using a Shared Access Signature

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to construct a shared access signature for retrieving messages from a queue.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to construct a shared access signature for retrieving messages from a queue.

trans-unit.source: This signature grants message processing permissions for the queue.
trans-unit.target: This signature grants message processing permissions for the queue.

trans-unit.source: Finally, this example uses the shared access signature to retrieve a message from the queue.
trans-unit.target: Finally, this example uses the shared access signature to retrieve a message from the queue.

trans-unit.source: Examine the following signed signature fields, the construction of the StringToSign string, and the construction of the URL that calls the Get Messages operation after the shared access signature authenticates:
trans-unit.target: Examine the following signed signature fields, the construction of the StringToSign string, and the construction of the URL that calls the Get Messages operation after the shared access signature authenticates:

trans-unit.source: Example: Add a Message using a Shared Access Signature
trans-unit.target: Example: Add a Message using a Shared Access Signature

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to construct a shared access signature for adding a message to a queue.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to construct a shared access signature for adding a message to a queue.

trans-unit.source: This signature grants add permissions for the queue.
trans-unit.target: This signature grants add permissions for the queue.

trans-unit.source: Finally, this example uses the signature to add a message.
trans-unit.target: Finally, this example uses the signature to add a message.

trans-unit.source: Examine the following signed signature fields, the construction of the StringToSign string, and the construction of the URL that calls the Put Message operation after the shared access signature authenticates:
trans-unit.target: Examine the following signed signature fields, the construction of the StringToSign string, and the construction of the URL that calls the Put Message operation after the shared access signature authenticates:

trans-unit.source: Example: Peek at Messages and Get a Message using a Shared Access Signature
trans-unit.target: Example: Peek at Messages and Get a Message using a Shared Access Signature

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to construct a shared access signature for peeking at the next message in a queue and retrieving the message count of the queue.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to construct a shared access signature for peeking at the next message in a queue and retrieving the message count of the queue.

trans-unit.source: This signature grants read permissions for the queue.
trans-unit.target: This signature grants read permissions for the queue.

trans-unit.source: Finally, this example uses the shared access signature to peek at a message and then read the queues metadata, which includes the message count.
trans-unit.target: Finally, this example uses the shared access signature to peek at a message and then read the queues metadata, which includes the message count.

trans-unit.source: The request is made within the time frame specified by the shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: The request is made within the time frame specified by the shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: The request does not violate any term of an associated stored access policy.
trans-unit.target: The request does not violate any term of an associated stored access policy.

trans-unit.source: The queue specified by the request is the same queue authorized by the shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: The queue specified by the request is the same queue authorized by the shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: Example: Query a Table using a Shared Access Signature
trans-unit.target: Example: Query a Table using a Shared Access Signature

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to construct a shared access signature for querying entities in a table.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to construct a shared access signature for querying entities in a table.

trans-unit.source: The signature grants query permissions for a specific range in the table.
trans-unit.target: The signature grants query permissions for a specific range in the table.

trans-unit.source: Finally, this example uses the shared access signature to query entities within the range.
trans-unit.target: Finally, this example uses the shared access signature to query entities within the range.

trans-unit.source: Examine the following signed signature fields, the construction of the StringToSign string, and the construction of the URL that calls the Query Entities operation.
trans-unit.target: Examine the following signed signature fields, the construction of the StringToSign string, and the construction of the URL that calls the Query Entities operation.

trans-unit.source: The results of this Query Entities operation will only include entities in the range defined by <languageKeyword>startpk</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>startrk</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>endpk</languageKeyword>, and <languageKeyword>endrk</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: The results of this Query Entities operation will only include entities in the range defined by <languageKeyword>startpk</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>startrk</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>endpk</languageKeyword>, and <languageKeyword>endrk</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: Example: Update a Table using a Shared Access Signature
trans-unit.target: Example: Update a Table using a Shared Access Signature

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to construct a shared access signature for updating entities in a table.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to construct a shared access signature for updating entities in a table.

trans-unit.source: The signature grants update permissions for a specific range of entities.
trans-unit.target: The signature grants update permissions for a specific range of entities.

trans-unit.source: Finally, this example uses the shared access signature to update an entity in the range.
trans-unit.target: Finally, this example uses the shared access signature to update an entity in the range.

trans-unit.source: Examine the following signed signature fields, the construction of the StringToSign string, and the construction of the URL that calls the Update Entity operation.
trans-unit.target: Examine the following signed signature fields, the construction of the StringToSign string, and the construction of the URL that calls the Update Entity operation.

trans-unit.source: The Update Entity operation can only update entities within the partition range defined by <languageKeyword>startpk</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>endpk</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: The Update Entity operation can only update entities within the partition range defined by <languageKeyword>startpk</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>endpk</languageKeyword>.
